humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The " calendar " oracle bone inscriptions from " Zi " from " Stop ", the variant form from " Lin ", the form of passing under the Hebian forest, the meaning of experience (Luo Zhenyu, etc.). The original meaning of " calendar " is passage, and when it is used for the four o'clock movement, it leads to the " calendar " (Chen Dingmin) of the calendar .

Another way of saying that " calendar " non-knowing the word, but from the Phonogram only Li sound, "said the text": "Li read if the calendar." This theory believes that everything that the foot passes has the meaning of passing, and it is not necessary to pass by Helin (Li Xiaoding). "Shuowen": "Li, Guoye . From the end of the sound." Pressing " Zi " and " Li " can be pure sound symbols or both meaning symbols. In ancient times, when you went out, it was grass fields and woods. It is also common sense to use the meaning of " Zi " and " Stop ". Therefore, " li " may be a pictophonetic character, or it may be a pictophonetic character with a sense of meaning.

The inscriptions from " Sui " to " Zhi " are added from " Chang ". " Chang " is the province of " Stone ". The meaning here is not clear, or it is only complicated writing. Lin Yiguang thought it meant to change, Takada Tada Zhou thought that where the elephants lived, they were all businessmen. There is also no " stop ", which is abbreviated as " calendar ", " calendar " and " calendar " are the same characters in different forms. The oracle bones are used as the name of the zhen person, and the inscriptions on the bronze inscriptions have the meaning of experience. Mao Gongding: "From now on, going in and out of fate is on the outside." Also used as a place name, Yu Ding: "As for the calendar." The " calendar " in bronze inscription can be borrowed as " 𤯌 ", refer to " 𤯌 ".
humanum_short_description_en: " Calendar " oracle bone inscriptions from " Zi " from " Zhi ", variants from " Lin ", will pass under the Hebian forest, will experience the meaning (Luo Zhenyu, etc.). The original meaning of " calendar " is passage, and when it is used for the four o'clock movement, it leads to the " calendar " (Chen Dingmin) of the calendar .
humanum_full_description:
「歷」甲骨文從「秝」從「止」，異體從「林」，會在禾邊林下經過之形，會經歷之意(羅振玉等)。「歷」的本義為經過，用於四時運行，便引伸出曆法之「曆」(陳定民)。

　　另一種說法認為「歷」非會意字，而是從止秝聲的形聲字，《說文》：「秝，讀若歷」。此說認為足之所經皆有經過之義，不必定要在禾林邊過(李孝定)。《說文》：「歷，過也。从止厤聲。」按「秝」、「厤」可為純粹聲符，亦可能兼為義符。古時出門便為禾田、樹林，以「秝」、「止」會經過之意，亦在常理中。故「歷」可能是形聲字，亦可能是形聲兼會意字。

　　金文從「秝」從「止」外，加從「厂」，「厂」為「石」之省，於此用義不明，或只為繁筆，林義光以為有推移之意，高田忠周以為象人之所居，皆可商。亦有不從「止」，簡作「厤」，「厤」、「歷」同字異體。甲骨用作貞人名，金文文例已有經歷之意，毛公鼎：「厤自今，出入尃命于外」，「厤自今」猶云「自今以往」或「從今以後」。又用為地名，禹鼎：「至于歷內」。金文「歷」可假借為「𤯌」，參「𤯌」。
humanum_short_description: 「歷」甲骨文從「秝」從「止」，異體從「林」，會在禾邊林下經過之形，會經歷之意(羅振玉等)。「歷」的本義為經過，用於四時運行，便引伸出曆法之「曆」(陳定民)。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
歷 (Simplified: 历)
Pinyin: lì
English Definition: to experience; to undergo; to pass through; all; each; every; history
Total strokes: 16; Radical: 止
Pictophonetic: 止 indicates the sound; 厤 (calendar) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿸ Surround from upper left
    • 厤 [ lì ] to calculate; the calendar
    • 止 [ zhǐ ] to stop, to halt; to detain; to desist
Example Words:
歷史 [ lì shǐ ]: history; Classifiers: 门
歷程 [ lì chéng ]: course; process
歷來 [ lì lái ]: always; throughout (a period of time); (of) all-time
More: 歷* | *歷 | *歷*

(Simplified: 历)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 止 indicates the sound; 厤 (calendar) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿸ Surround from upper left
    • 厤 [ lì ] to calculate; the calendar
    • 止 [ zhǐ ] to stop, to halt; to detain; to desist
①曆法，歷術。
②曆書，按當年的日、周和月順序載有天文學等資料的出版物。
③次第，依次而定。［例］命宰歷卿大夫至於庶民土田之數，而賦犧牲，以共山林名川之祀。——《禮記·月令》。注：“歷，猶次也。”
④盡；遍。［［合］歷心(盡心，重視)；歷行(遍行，走遍)；歷問(遍問)；歷閱(遍讀)。
⑤逐一；逐個地。

「 歷 」甲骨文從「 秝 」從「 止 」，異體從「 林 」，會在禾邊林下經過之形，會經歷之意(羅振玉等)。「 歷 」的本義為經過，用於四時運行，便引伸出曆法之「 曆 」(陳定民)。 另一種說法認為「 歷 」非會意字，而是從止秝聲的形聲字，《說文》：「秝，讀若歷」。此說認為足之所經皆有經過之義，不必定要在禾林邊過(李孝定)。《說文》：「歷，過也。从止厤聲。」按「 秝 」、「 厤 」可為純粹聲符，亦可能兼為義符。古時出門便為禾田、樹林，以「 秝 」、「 止 」會經過之意，亦在常理中。故「 歷 」可能是形聲字，亦可能是形聲兼會意字。 金文從「 秝 」從「 止 」外，加從「 厂 」，「 厂 」為「 石 」之省，於此用義不明，或只為繁筆，林義光以為有推移之意，高田忠周以為象人之所居，皆可商。亦有不從「 止 」，簡作「 厤 」，「 厤 」、「 歷 」同字異體。甲骨用作貞人名，金文文例已有經歷之意，毛公鼎：「厤自今，出入尃命于外」，「厤自今」猶云「自今以往」或「從今以後」。又用為地名，禹鼎：「至于歷內」。金文「 歷 」可假借為「 𤯌 」，參「 𤯌 」。

The original meaning of " calendar" is passage, and when it is used for the four o'clock movement, it leads to the " calendar" (Chen Dingmin) of the calendar. Another way of saying that " calendar" non-knowing the word, but from the Phonogram only Li sound, "said the text": "Li read if the calendar." This theory believes that everything that the foot passes has the meaning of passing, and it is not necessary to pass by Helin (Li Xiaoding). "Shuowen": "Li, Guoye. From the end of the sound." Pressing " Zi" and " Li" can be pure sound symbols or both meaning symbols. In ancient times, when you went out, it was grass fields and woods. It is also common sense to use the meaning of " Zi" and " Stop". Therefore, " li" may be a pictophonetic character, or it may be a pictophonetic character with a sense of meaning. The inscriptions from " Sui" to " Zhi" are added from " Chang". " Chang" is the province of " Stone". The meaning here is not clear, or it is only complicated writing. Lin Yiguang thought it meant to change, Takada Tada Zhou thought that where the elephants lived, they were all businessmen. There is also no " stop", which is abbreviated as " calendar", " calendar" and " calendar" are the same characters in different forms. The oracle bones are used as the name of the zhen person, and the inscriptions on the bronze inscriptions have the meaning of experience. Mao Gongding: "From now on, going in and out of fate is on the outside." Also used as a place name, Yu Ding: "As for the calendar." 歷字的基本解释

歷
lì
见“历”。

歷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lì］
［《廣韻》郎擊切，入錫，來。］
亦作“厤1”。亦作“歴1”。“历1”的繁体字。
(1)经历；经过。指时间上的。
(2)经历；经过。指空间上的。
(3)行；游历。
(4)越过。
(5)遭逢；经受。
(6)依照次序。
(7)谓先后担任各种官职。
(8)指担任。
(9)多；曾经多次。
(10)尽；遍。
(11)长久。
(12)发出；流露。
(13)审视；察看。
(14)选择。
(15)犹离。分别。
(16)清楚。
(17)稀疏。
(18)乱，紊乱。
(19)引申为扰乱，触犯。
(20)炼。
(21)“手歷”或“歷頭”的省称。宋代的一种赋税凭证。
(22)同“曆”。历法。
(23)同“曆”。指善于历算的人。
(24)同“曆”。指记载年月日节气的书册。
(25)同“曆”。历数，气数。
(26)“靂”的古字。
(27)通“瀝”。清酒。
(28)通“櫪”。拶指。古代刑罚。参见“歷指”。
(29)通“櫪

歷字的康熙字典解释

【辰集下】【止字部】　歷； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页577第14
〔古文〕?【唐韻】郞擊切【集韻】【韻會】狼狄切，?音靂。【說文】過也。一曰經歷。【書·梓材】殺人歷人。【註】歷人者，罪人所過。【前漢·天文志】合散犯守，陵歷鬭食。【韋昭註】自下往觸之曰犯，居其宿曰守，經之爲歷，突掩爲陵，星相擊爲鬭。　又次也。【禮·月令】季冬，命宰歷卿大夫至於庶民。【註】歷，猶次也。　又盡也。謂徧及之也。【書·盤庚】歷告爾百姓于朕志。【前漢·劉向傳】歷周唐之所進以爲法。【師古註】歷謂歷觀之。　又踰也，越也。【孟子】不歷位而相與言。【大戴記】竊盜歷法妄行。　又疎也。【宋玉·登徒子好色賦】齞脣歷齒。【註】歷，猶疎也。【後漢·列女傳】蓬髮歷齒，未知禮則。　又錯也。【莊子·天地篇】交臂歷指。　又亂也。【大戴記】歷者，獄之所由生。【註】歷，歷亂也。【鮑照詩】黃絲歷亂不可治。　又歷歷，行列貌。【古樂府】歷歷種白楡。　又釜鬲謂之歷。【史記·滑稽傳】銅歷爲棺。【索隱曰】歷卽釜鬲也。　又歷錄，文章之貌。見【詩疏】。　又寂歷，猶寂寞也。【張說詩】空山

歷字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体旧字形
歷字的起名意思

暂无。

["Guangyun" Lang hits and cuts, enters the tin, come. ]
Also known as "Calendar 1". Also known as "歴1". Traditional characters of "历1".
(1) Experience; after. Refers to time.
(2) Experience; after. Refers to spatially.
(3) Line; travel.
(4) Cross over.
(5) Meet; endure.
(6) According to the order.
(7) Said that he successively held various official positions.
(8) Refers to serving.

(10) Exhaust; times.

(16) Clear.
(17) Sparse.

(20) Refining.
(21) The provincial name of "hand calendar" or "litou". A tax voucher in the Song Dynasty.
(22) Same as "calendar". Calendar.
(23) Same as "calendar". Refers to people who are good at calendars.
(24) Same as "calendar". Refers to a book that records the solar terms of the year, month, and day.
(25) Same as "calendar". The number of calendars, the number of breaths.
(26) The ancient word for "Li".
(27) Through "Li". Sake.
(28) Through "枥".拶指. Ancient punishment. See "calendar".
